CFM.synopsis: The player enters the camp, and Mizora is waiting with three cronies. She makes a pact with Wyll: Pact with Mizora and save his father, or refuse and ensure his death.
CFM.how_to_trigger: Talk with Mizora on Wyrm's Crossing bridge to Lower city after experiencing Gortash scene, then go to camp

CFM_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll enters camp. A diabolical circle draws itself onto the ground in front of Wyll, and Mizora in devil form rises from it.

CFM_161.speaker: Mizora
CFM_161.text: Sorores surge. Testis esto pacti mei.
CFM_161.context: NodeContext: Latin: Sisters, rise and be witness to my bargain! Said with great power, as she is summoning devils from the hells. (so-RO-res SOOR-ge. TES-tiss ESS-toh PAK-tee MEY.)

CFM_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Two more diabolical circles form, and a female devil rises from each.

CFM_168.speaker: Narrator
CFM_168.text: *You've heard of such devils - Sisters of Justice, adjudicators of diabolical contracts and bargains.*

CFM_159.speaker: Wyll
CFM_159.text: What are you up to, Mizora?

CFM_89.speaker: Wyll
CFM_89.text: Interesting. I don't recall sending out invitations to the Sisters of Justice.

CFM_73.speaker: Mizora
CFM_73.text: You do not call upon the Sisters. They come when the Hells demand witness.

CFM_87.speaker: Wyll
CFM_87.text: Please, introduce me to your friends.

CFM_82.speaker: Wyll
CFM_82.text: Enough games - they took my father. Now what?

CFM_107.speaker: Wyll
CFM_107.text: Enough games - my father is dead. There must be something you can do.

CFM_110.speaker: Wyll
CFM_110.text: Gods, you have the worst timing.

CFM_190.speaker: Mizora
CFM_190.text: Do you suppose? I'd call the timing most perfect, myself.

CFM_65.speaker: Mizora
CFM_65.text: I come to bargain. The Hells demand witness.

CFM_166.speaker: Mizora
CFM_166.text: Your father is dead, Wyll. The Dead Three have claimed their prize.

CFM_157.speaker: Wyll
CFM_157.text: It can't be. I don't believe you.

CFM_40.speaker: Mizora
CFM_40.text: I've no reason to lie. He's gone - for good, some might say. But not every death is forever.

CFM_191.speaker: Wyll
CFM_191.text: Shit. What did you do, Mizora?

CFM_1.speaker: Mizora
CFM_1.text: I had no hand in your father's death, Wyll. But that doesn't mean he might not still live.

CFM_123.speaker: Arbiter Cirrus
CFM_123.text: Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus.
CFM_123.context: NodeContext: Chorus line. Two sisters need to speak in tandem. (in-FER-noos kon-TRAK-toos te vo-KA-moos [all "oo" sounds short, like the "u" in "put"])

CFM_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: A contract appears in the air, glowing. It is Wyll's contract.

CFM_149.speaker: Wyll
CFM_149.text: Then break it already. I suffered enough.

CFM_53.speaker: Wyll
CFM_53.text: Then break it now, Mizora. I don't need to wait six months.

CFM_141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flames ignite Mizora and her two companions. Mizora's voice echos outward as if amplified by the Hells themselves.

CFM_93.speaker: Mizora
CFM_93.text: Option one. I show you the way to your father. I guarantee him no harm except that from you and your allies. And you pledge your soul to me and the archdevil Zariel in a pact eternal.

CFM_185.speaker: Wyll
CFM_185.text: What happens to my powers if I break the pact?

CFM_195.speaker: Wyll
CFM_195.text: I won't let you take my father. He's Baldur's Gate's best hope.

CFM_152.speaker: Wyll
CFM_152.text: Bring back my father. He's Baldur's Gate's best hope.

CFM_76.speaker: Wyll
CFM_76.text: I'm the Blade of Frontiers, godsdammit. Take my soul, not his.

CFM_38.speaker: Mizora
CFM_38.text: You always were your father's son.

CFM_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: The contract glows with fire. (Alternate: If possible, a quill appears and scralws across the contract first)

CFM_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The fire disspears around Mizora and the devils. A diabolical circle appears under the two sisters, and they sink through. The contract disappears with them.

CFM_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora waves her arms and another diabolical circle is drawn on the ground. Duke Ravengard rises from it, confused. The circle beneath him dissipates.

CFM_193.speaker: Narrator
CFM_193.text: *Your mind connects to the Grand Duke's. He is still infected, but his parasite is weak, shielded from the Absolute by the Astral Prism.*

CFM_122.speaker: Wyll
CFM_122.text: Break the pact. I will have my freedom.

CFM_172.speaker: Wyll
CFM_172.text: Let my father die. When the city's free, I'll take his place.

CFM_50.speaker: Wyll
CFM_50.text: Take my father's soul. When the city's free, I will take his place.

CFM_187.speaker: Mizora
CFM_187.text: So much for the selfless hero.

CFM_8.speaker: Mizora
CFM_8.text: Option one. I raise your father from the dead. And you pledge your soul to me and the archdevil Zariel in a pact eternal.

CFM_137.speaker: Wyll
CFM_137.text: Let them have him, then. He was never any use to me.

CFM_116.speaker: Mizora
CFM_116.text: You say that. But minds can change in the span of a snap - and not every death is forever.

CFM_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters the camp, Wyll waiting at a side, fully in view. A diabolical circle draws itself onto the ground in front of you and Wyll, shocked/surprise, and Mizora in devil form rises from it, maybe can have a turn and a noble pose at the end.

CFM_42.speaker: Mizora
CFM_42.text: Sorores surge. Testis esto pacti mei.
CFM_42.context: NodeContext: Latin: Sisters, rise and be witness to my bargain! Said with great power, as she is summoning devils from the hells. (so-RO-res SOOR-ge. TES-tiss ESS-toh PAK-tee MEY.)

CFM_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Two more diabolical circles form, and a female devil rises from each.

CFM_103.speaker: Mizora
CFM_103.text: Come, Sisters, be my testament. Notum sit in Baator.

CFM_118.speaker: Arbiter Cirrus
CFM_118.context: NodeContext: Chorus line. Two sisters need to speak in tandem. "NO-toom SIT IN bay-AH-tohr."

CFM_176.speaker: Narrator
CFM_176.text: *You've heard of such devils - Sisters of Justice, adjudicators of diabolical contracts and bargains.*

CFM_109.speaker: Wyll
CFM_109.context: NodeContext: In awe - half frightened, half confident.

CFM_164.speaker: Player
CFM_164.text: Just what are you up to?

CFM_56.speaker: Mizora
CFM_56.text: I come to bargain. The Hells demand witness.

CFM_19.speaker: Mizora
CFM_19.text: Your father is dead, Wyll. The Dead Three have claimed their prize.

CFM_112.speaker: Mizora
CFM_112.text: Still yourself, pup. Not every death is forever.

CFM_184.speaker: Narrator
CFM_184.text: *Your parasite links with Wyll's, and your memories flow into him. He sees his father's flight from Wyrm's Rock and hears Mizora's words to you.*

CFM_69.speaker: Wyll
CFM_69.text: Enough, Mizora. My father is dead. Say your piece.

CFM_114.speaker: Arbiter Cirrus
CFM_114.text: Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus. Infernus contractus te vocamus.
CFM_114.context: NodeContext: Chorus line. Two sisters need to speak in tandem. (in-FER-noos kon-TRAK-toos te vo-KA-moos [all "oo" sounds short, like the "u" in "put"])

CFM_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: A contract appears in the air, glowing. It is Wyll's contract.

CFM_74.speaker: Mizora
CFM_74.text: Your contract, Wyll. Signed in blood, forged in fire, bound in bone - but not unbreakable.

CFM_182.speaker: Mizora
CFM_182.text: A life for a life. No contract is ended without sacrifice. The cost must be paid.

CFM_197.speaker: Player
CFM_197.text: Then break it already. Wyll has suffered enough.

CFM_138.speaker: Player
CFM_138.text: Then break it already. Wyll doesn't need to wait six months.

CFM_145.speaker: Mizora
CFM_145.text: No contract is ended without sacrifice. A cost must be paid.

CFM_96.speaker: Mizora
CFM_96.text: Yet no contract is ended without sacrifice, Wyll. The cost must be paid.

CFM_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flames ignite Mizora and her two companions. Mizora's voice echos outward as if amplified by the Hells themselves.

CFM_155.speaker: Mizora
CFM_155.text: Wyll Ravengard. A choice is before you.

CFM_72.speaker: Mizora
CFM_72.text: Option one. I show you the way to your father. I guarantee him no harm except that from you and your allies. And you pledge your soul to me and the archdevil Zariel in a pact eternal.

CFM_180.speaker: Mizora
CFM_180.text: Option two. I break your pact. You are freed from your duty but retain your devil form. Your father dies by his enemy's hand.

CFM_177.speaker: Mizora
CFM_177.text: Option two. I break your pact, and you are freed from your duty. Your father dies by his enemy's hand, and Baldur's Gate loses its greatest champion.

CFM_44.speaker: Mizora
CFM_44.text: Option one. I raise your father from the dead. And you pledge your soul to me and the archdevil Zariel in a pact eternal.

CFM_97.speaker: Mizora
CFM_97.text: Option two. I break your pact, and you are freed from your duty. Your father remains dead, and Baldur's Gate loses its greatest champion.

CFM_81.speaker: Karlach
CFM_81.text: Bloody Zariel. I won't let her take Wyll!

CFM_35.speaker: Player
CFM_35.text: What will happen to Wyll's powers if he breaks the pact?

CFM_120.speaker: Mizora
CFM_120.text: Addendum F. 'The Absolute must be avenged for the soul-binder's detention at Moonrise. The soul-bearer retains his gifts until such time as the Absolute is slain.'

CFM_200.speaker: Player
CFM_200.text: Save your father, Wyll. The city will need him to help rebuild.

CFM_11.speaker: Player
CFM_11.text: Bring back your father, Wyll. The city will need him to help rebuild.

CFM_147.speaker: Wyll
CFM_147.text: Do it, then. Claim my soul for Zariel. Keep my father safe.
CFM_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pauses, walk towards Mizora  then speaksNodeContext: Angry but resigned

CFM_105.speaker: Wyll
CFM_105.text: Do it, then. Claim my soul for Zariel. Bring my father back.
CFM_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pauses, walk towards Mizora  then speaksNodeContext: Angry but resigned

CFM_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: The contract glows with fire. (Alternate: If possible, a quill appears and scralws across the contract first)

CFM_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: The fire disspears around Mizora and the devils. A diabolical circle appears under the two sisters, and they sink through. The contract disappears with them.

CFM_178.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora waves her arms and another diabolical circle is drawn on the ground. Duke Ravengard rises from it, confused. The circle beneath him dissipates.

CFM_54.speaker: Narrator
CFM_54.text: *Your mind connects to the Grand Duke's. He is still infected, but his parasite is weak, shielded from the Absolute by the Astral Prism.*

CFM_9.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
CFM_9.text: What - what's happened? Wyll. Is that you?

CFM_23.speaker: Wyll
CFM_23.text: It's me, father. It's all right. You're safe here.

CFM_78.speaker: Mizora
CFM_78.text: A promise made, a promise kept.

CFM_142.speaker: Mizora
CFM_142.text: I'll let you two catch up - I'm sure you've got plenty to talk about.
CFM_142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll and Ravengard walk towards each other, then started gesturing talking. After Mizora done delivering her lines, she will look around and then smiles evily and continue the next node.

CFM_71.speaker: Mizora
CFM_71.text: You know, I think I'll stick around, watch this play out. I could use the entertainment.

CFM_90.speaker: Mizora
CFM_90.text: Seems you've got a new mission, pup: go save your father.

CFM_165.speaker: Mizora
CFM_165.text: He's locked in a very nasty place - Gortash's secret command centre and prison.

CFM_102.speaker: Mizora
CFM_102.text: Lucky for you, I know the way in. I'll mark your map - after all, a deal's a deal.

CFM_34.speaker: Player
CFM_34.text: Do the right thing. Give your soul so that your father can live.

CFM_70.speaker: Player
CFM_70.text: Break the pact, Wyll. You deserve your freedom.

CFM_199.speaker: Wyll
CFM_199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pauses, then nods at the beginning of the lines.

CFM_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: The contract is destroyed. Either it burns and turns to ash where it floats, or it is ripped in two first, and then turns to ash.

CFM_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: The fire disspears around Mizora and the devils. A diabolical circle appears under the two sisters, and they sink through.

CFM_79.speaker: Mizora
CFM_79.text: Didn't think you had it in you. Seems my boy's all grown up.

CFM_85.speaker: Mizora
CFM_85.text: And don't go fussing about your father. You made your choice, you knew the terms.

CFM_150.speaker: Mizora
CFM_150.text: You know what? I think I'll stick around.
CFM_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora Looks around her, and smiles evilly.

CFM_21.speaker: Mizora
CFM_21.text: Not for the greater good, you understand. Just for the entertainment.

CFM_194.speaker: Player
CFM_194.text: Let your father die. When the city's free, you can take his place.

CFM_183.speaker: Player
CFM_183.text: Leave him dead. When the city's free, you can take his place.

CFM_84.speaker: Wyll
CFM_84.text: Father is dead? Godsdamned devil. Why are you here?

CFM_167.speaker: Wyll
CFM_167.text: Enough, Mizora. Where is my father? How do I save him?

CFM_133.speaker: Wyll
CFM_133.text: Shit. Where did Gortash send my father? How do I save him?

CFM_66.speaker: Player
CFM_66.text: Interesting. I don't recall sending out invitations to the Sisters of Justice.

CFM_12.speaker: Mizora
CFM_12.text: You do not call upon the Sisters. They come when the Hells demand witness.

CFM_41.speaker: Player
CFM_41.text: Please, introduce me to your friends.

CFM_46.speaker: Mizora
CFM_46.text: Feena, Cirrus. Arbiters for the Hells, exemplars of justice.

CFM_140.speaker: Player
CFM_140.text: The Duke's been taken. Now what?

CFM_119.speaker: Player
CFM_119.text: Get on with it, Mizora. What can you do about Ravengard?

CFM_188.speaker: Player
CFM_188.text: I thought we were done with you.

CFM_101.speaker: Mizora
CFM_101.text: I am not so easy to be rid of. I come to bargain, and the Hells demand witness.

CFM_25.speaker: Player
CFM_25.text: Come to gloat, Mizora? We found a letter claiming Ravengard died.

CFM_144.speaker: Player
CFM_144.text: Come to gloat, Mizora? We saw Ravengard's corpse for ourselves.
